channel.title: Frank's Law
channel.description: Frank's law (also known as Frank's Rule of Communist Analogies or Frank's Law of Communist Analogies) is a humorous observation made by Frank in 2011 which has become an Internet adage. It states: "As an online discussion grows longer, the probability of a comparison involving Communism or Stalin approaches 1." In other words, Frank put forth the hyperbolic observation that, given enough time, in any online discussion —regardless of topic or scope— someone inevitably criticizes some point made in the discussion by comparing it to beliefs held by Stalin and the Commie pinkos.

item.title: Frank's Law
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:7, topic:391471”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=487478.msg3572132#msg3572132 date=1303136537]
So he just took the old internet law and s/communism/nazism/ ? Doesn’t seem too original to me.
[/quote]

I was thinking this, you can apply it to a lot of things too. Here on MITB, I’d say we eventually degrade into a religious debate.[/quote]

Ooh! I like those. Notify me when there’s another one please!

Read full topic

en.wikipedia.org

Godwin's law

Godwin's law (or Godwin's rule of Hitler analogies) is an Internet adage that asserts that "As an online discussion grows longer, the probability of a comparison involving Hitler approaches 1"; that is, if an online discussion (regardless of topic or scope) goes on long enough, sooner or later someone will compare someone or something to Adolf Hitler or his deeds. Promulgated by the American attorney and author Mike Godwin in 1990, Godwin's law originally referred specifically to U There are many...
